page.title: 08Charnwood local History 1
page.content: {Ulverscroft Priory,}now in ruins,was founded in 1150.It was a small August_ inian monastic house which provided welcome refuge for travellers crossing the forest.It was dissolved in 1539, when its bell,Tomasat,was moved to Newtown Linford Church,where it remains.The moat and fish ponds belonging to the priory have been re_ excavated recently.{Beacon Hill}at 248 mtrs is the 2nd highest point in Leics It may have had artificial defences as long ago as the New Stone Age and was certainly in use in the Bronze Age,for some spearheads and other artifacts have been found.As the name suggests,the hill was used for beacon fires,which still occur on special royal occassions.{Aldermans Haw,}and other places in the area named Hays, Heys or Haw,were ancient hedged fields once surrounded by unenclosed forest.
